title: TOI
content:
The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) on Tuesday announced its first list of candidates for the upcoming Bihar Assembly elections, fielding outgoing Deputy Chief Ministers Samrat Choudhary and Vijay Kumar Sinha from Tarapur and Lakhisarai constituencies, respectively. Bihar’s 243-seat Assembly will go to polls in two phases on November 6 and 11, with results on November 14. The BJP is contesting 101 seats and has named 71 candidates in its first list. The NDA has finalised its seat-sharing formula, allotting 101 seats each to BJP and JD(U), 29 to LJP(R), and six each to RLM and HAM(S). Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said NDA allies reached the agreement cordially.

U.S. President Donald Trump expressed disappointment that Russian President Vladimir Putin has not ended the war in Ukraine, saying it “makes him look very bad” and could be resolved quickly. Speaking alongside Argentine President Javier Milei at the White House, Trump urged Putin to settle the conflict and warned of Russia’s economic struggles, including long lines for gasoline. Trump also confirmed that Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy will visit Washington on Friday and discussed the potential delivery of Tomahawk cruise missiles to Ukraine, highlighting the balance between defending Ukraine’s territory and the risk of escalation with Russia. Watch the full press conference here.#DonaldTrump #VladimirPutin #UkraineWar #TomahawkMissiles #USPolitics #Zelenskyy #WhiteHouse #Russia #InternationalRelations #GlobalConflict
